title: I don't want to miss my frens

body: because of lgbtiphobia
body_html: because of lgbtiphobia

guild.description: Head to 4chan and just post all the pepes and make all the frens you want.
guild.description_html: Head to 4chan and just post all the pepes and make all the frens you want.
guild.name: frenworld

post.title: I don't want to miss my frens

body:
I don't know what 98% of those flags are for but for the ones I do know...

Transgender people have an innate conflict between their bodies and their minds. Even with surgery and being allowed to live as a man / woman they may never feel quite right in their skin. This isn't ideal from a wanting-to-stay-alive perspective - especially if they change their mind after surgery and miss their old junk. No matter how you tweak the society this inner conflict will still be there.

Homosexuality is different because there is no innate conflict - rather, depression can come from social shunning, and that could have been why gays were committing suicide in the past. But those days are over in most western countries, at least for the younger generations who grew up in an accepting culture.

However I doubt things will really improve because gay culture is so hedonistic, so tawdry, doesn't value commitment, places little value on traditionally masculine traits except grotesque caricatures of them in porn, and is obsessed with victimhood and eschews personal responsibility, which is absolutely not an empowering way to look at life. In the long-term this is very unfulfilling for the men involved and they can wake up one day realising they've squandered their potential in a similar way to women who hit the wall.

This is why I think it's important to cultivate an alternative identity for homo and bisexual men, and to push back against victimhood politics, which is why I've started +Thebes.

body:
The latest theory is that it is not genetic but instead related to hormone levels in utero

But clearly social environment affects at least some people's sexual preference. I don't think anyone believes it's a coincidence that so many lesbians have a history of being abused by men in the past.

post.title: I don't want to miss my frens

body: But fren why would 98% of all people be attracted to the opposite sex if it just 'sneaks up' on them? Since the goal of all species is survival, and that requires reproduction, which requires a male and a female, it would seem that being attracted to the opposite sex is therefore the 'natural' or 'normal' state. You probably have no idea why you feel hunger, either, but it's a natural and normal state experienced by almost everyone.
body_html: But fren why would 98% of all people be attracted to the opposite sex if it just 'sneaks up' on them? Since the goal of all species is survival, and that requires reproduction, which requires a male and a female, it would seem that being attracted to the opposite sex is therefore the 'natural' or 'normal' state. You probably have no idea why you feel hunger, either, but it's a natural and normal state experienced by almost everyone.

post.title: I don't want to miss my frens

body:
No idea what causes it - there seem to be lots of things that seem to make it more likely, in-utero testosterone levels being one. I think it's plausible that there's more than one "type" of homosexuality, with effeminate homosexual men being something close to transgender, but without that feeling of dysmorphia. I.e. they might just be men with women's brains, and that's why they prefer men, as most "women" do.

But if you look at militaries throughout history, prisons, pirate ships, monasteries; homosexual behaviour happens anywhere men are together without women. So I think the potential for it exists in many, if not most men - but it only emerges in certain circumstances - sometimes traumatic ones; sometimes when there's no better option; sometimes when it would improve bonds between men in a group.

Personally I think this second type of homosexuality / bisexuality evolved to make men more loyal to each other when e.g. out fighting a war. These men won't necessarily pass on their genes directly but their sacrifice can bring glory and riches to their tribes; thus passing their genes on as their families grow without them. 

There's this adage *"I'd give my life for 2 siblings or 8 cousins"* - because genetically, that is what's needed to pass on your genes even if you never have kids yourself.

These men won't necessarily pass on their genes directly but their sacrifice can bring glory and riches to their tribes; thus passing their genes on as their families grow without them.

There's this adage "I'd give my life for 2 siblings or 8 cousins" - because genetically, that is what's needed to pass on your genes even if you never have kids yourself.

post.title: I don't want to miss my frens

body:
Don't know much about gay men but I can share my experience as a lesbian. I have a twin brother and always wondered if the whole testosterone thing applies to me. I'm not physically masculine but used to think I was trans when I was a teen (then realised changing sex isn't possible and that's a dealbreaker for me). In some ways I have dysphoria because I hate being treated like a woman when everything about my personality is stereotypically male. I think if there wasn't any of the shitty parts of being gay and female then I wouldn't ever had any problems.

Most lesbians may seem lesbian but are febfem (they only date women but are attracted to both). The ones that are transmen or I guess ultra lesbian like me is something else. I really think there's some kind of brain disorder because it's more than just sexual attraction. It's my interests, the way I problem solve, deal with conflict, express myself, etc.
body_html:

body: There is nothing you stated above that I disagree with. On the other paw, 2% of humans are "broken" in their sexuality. It's few enough to not matter in term of the survival of the species. I do find it odd that we cater to them to the extent we do as it is actually private behavior that they have complete control over. Transsexuals are the worst looking for a surgical cure for mental illness. The productive path is to be at peace with the body you were born with because there is no changing it in this life. Your sex is written in (nearly) every cell of your body. There is nothing we can do today to re-write that code. It is what it is.

parent.body: But fren why would 98% of all people be attracted to the opposite sex if it just 'sneaks up' on them? Since the goal of all species is survival, and that requires reproduction, which requires a male and a female, it would seem that being attracted to the opposite sex is therefore the 'natural' or 'normal' state. You probably have no idea why you feel hunger, either, but it's a natural and normal state experienced by almost everyone.
parent.body_html: But fren why would 98% of all people be attracted to the opposite sex if it just 'sneaks up' on them? post.title: I don't want to miss my frens

body: I am riffing on those vibes, fren. We are all dealt a hand at birth and must resolve ourselves to the best possible actions available with the cards we have. I hate to see frens suffer, especially when their suffering is magnified by nonfrens who encourage them to do things that hurt them. I do think that sometimes we are too frenly and cater to the whims of a small vocal minority who base their personalities off their sexual proclivities, skin color, or political preference. Sometimes being too frenly hurts our frens and we need to give them a loving bop.
